intro: Salsola humifusa, commonly known as sandmat, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability, featuring a shallow root system and thick, waxy leaves to reduce water loss. It often thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is commonly found in deserts and coastal areas. Salsola humifusa plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small organisms in its ecosystem.
